1.text: Be imitators of God, as beloved children.

2.text: Walk in love, even as Christ also loved us and gave himself up for us as an offering and a sacrifice to God, a sweet-smelling fragrance.

3.text: But sexual immorality and all forms of impurity and greed should not even be mentioned among you, as is fitting for saints.

4.text: The same is true regarding filthy and foolish conversations as well as jokes which are not appropriate; instead, give thanks!

5.text: Know this for sure: no one who is sexually immoral, involved in impurity, greedy, or an idolater has any inheritance in the Kingdom of Christ and God.

6.text: Let no one deceive you with empty words; because of these things, the wrath of God is coming on the children of disobedience.

7.text: Therefore, do not share in their lot.

8.text: Indeed, you used to be in darkness, but now, you are light in the Lord. Walk as children of light,

9.text: for the fruit of the Spirit is in all [manner of] goodness, righteousness and truth.

10.text: Discern what is well-pleasing to the Lord!

11.text: Have no fellowship with the vain works of darkness, but rather, expose them for what they are.

12.text: It is a shame even to speak about the things which these people do in secret!

13.text: But all things are revealed when they are exposed to the light.

14.text: Therefore, it is said:  Awake, you sleeper, arise from the dead,   and Christ will shine on you.

15.text: Therefore, watch carefully how you live, not as unwise, but as wise [people],

16.text: making good use of time, because the days are evil.

17.text: Do not be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.

18.text: Do not get drunk with wine—this is reckless living—but be filled with the Spirit.

19.text: Speak to one another in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs! Sing and chant to the Lord in your heart,

20.text: always giving thanks for everything in the Name of our Lord Jesus Christ, even unto the God and Father.

21.text: [Finally], be in mutual subjection in the fear of Christ.

22.text: Wives, be subject to your own husbands as [you are] to the Lord.

23.text: For the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ is the head of the Church, and he is the savior of the body.

24.text: As the Church is subject to Christ, wives should likewise be subject to their own husbands in everything.

25.text: Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the Church and gave himself up for her

26.text: in order to sanctify her, having purified her by the washing of water with the word,

27.text: so that he might present her to himself in glory, without any spot or wrinkle or any such thing, but holy and flawless.

28.text: In the same way, a husband should love his wife as his [own] body. He who loves his own wife loves himself!

29.text: No man ever hates his own body but feeds it and cares for it, as the Lord also does for the Church.

30.text: Yes, we are members of his body, his very flesh and bones!

31.text: This is why a man will leave his father and mother and will be joined to his wife; and the two will become one flesh.

32.text: This is a great mystery: I speak concerning Christ and the Church.

33.text: Now concerning you: each one of you must also love his own wife even as his own self; and the wife must respect her husband.
